entry.title: [Protected Audiences] enableBiddingSignalsPrioritization in generateBid
entry.content:
This CL fixes `enableBiddingSignalsPrioritization` not being correctly

set on interest groups being passed to generateBid(). We were setting

useBiddingSignalsPrioritization instead (which may have been a name used

in earlier draft specs when adding the field).



Fixed: 1516980

Change-Id: I759bc99c2f656f6f2fd5c2413fad17acacefe54d

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5182114

Reviewed-by: Maks Orlovich

Commit-Queue: Matt Menke

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1245506}

entry.title: Extension Hats Survey To Show on Page Navigation
entry.content:
The trigger for the Extension Hats Survey that handles page navigation. has a bool that requires same page origin. This bool should be false

instead of true to allow the survey to show.

entry.title: Fix imports for model_unittest.py
entry.content:
Fix the import statements for model_unittest.py. Imports the dependency

on model as sync.model to be consistent with how the model and

model_util modules are resolved by gen_events.py and gen_validator.py.

However, in order for model_unittest.py to be run correctly, a wrapper

Python file was created in the parent directory (same directory as

gen_events.py and gen_validator.py). This way, the model_unittest.py

can still be run from the Chromium repository, albeit indirectly.



NO_BUG



Change-Id: I8e7843071d04bf9dd44dd5d259d16df5aee852be

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5179252

entry.title: [Extensions] Redundant start request metric for SWs.
entry.content:
New metric:

Extensions.ServiceWorkerBackground.RequestedWorkerStartForStartedWorker



Before this metric we were assuming that we were redundantly starting

a worker when the worker was already started/running. This metric

actually measures this so that we can measure the impact of the

extensions_features::kExtensionsServiceWorkerOptimizedEventDispatch

feature.

entry.title: [Tether][2/n] Use NetworkConnectionHandler in WifiHotspotConnector
entry.content:
This is part of a series of changes to support retrying a Wifi connection

for Instant Tether.



This change modifies WifiHotspotConnector to use NetworkConnectionHandler

instead of NetworkConnect to form a connection. NetworkConnectionHandler

gives access to callbacks on success and failure, allowing us to respond

to a failure and retry.

entry.title: Revert "Remove and simplify UI after VRB removal"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 4ec416a0dd6fe984ae5456311e2db03f059a888e.



Reason for revert: broke tree, see https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/win32-archive-rel/40323/overview



Original change's description:

> Remove and simplify UI after VRB removal

>

> After the VR Browser removal, there are a number of interfaces that

> had only a single implementation outside of testing, often with that

> implementation being either solely a no-op or having some additional

> complexity in order to support splitting the code into these interfaces.

> One of the most complex things that was now only enabled in tests was

> the `gvr_input_support` bool which enabled a lot of input infrastructure

> which is now not processed at all, thus enabling a lot of cleanups. This

> change thus removes the input infrastructure and the no-op interface

> methods. The most interesting removal caused by the removal of this UI

> infrastructure is that kWebVrExclusiveScreenToast could no longer be

> made visible from production code, but it could (and it's visibility

> was checked) from test code. While tests were modified because of this,

> it does not appear that any valid scenarios are now tested less.

>

> Two interface methods had some slightly complex behavior which was

> instead simplified:

> SchedulerDelegate's OnPose method was called by the

> `VrBrowserRendererThreadWin` to call a method onto the `BrowserRenderer`

> which then made a callback to the `SchedulerDelegate` who triggered a

> callback that it received from the `VrBrowserRendererThreadWin`, all on

> the same thread. This circler dependency was simplified to have

> `VrBrowserRendererThreadWin` both call `BrowserRenderer` directly (since

> it already owned it), and to call it's own follow-up method after an

> appropriate call was made.

>

> BrowserRendererBrowserInterface was now only used by tests to be

> notified when the visibility state of a requested UI had been changed,

> and it could only listen for the visibility state changes of one piece

> of UI at a time. Thus the BrowserRendererBrowserInterface was removed

> and replaced with a simple `OnceCallback` on the struct that was passed

> in to set up the wait for a visibility state change. This struct was

> also simplified as two different structs existed; one which was created

> by the tests and one which was created by the product code, with only

> very minimal differences that could easily be adapted.

>

> Other noteworthy interface changes are:

> SchedulerBrowserRendererInterface now only had one implementation and

> the interface itself wasn't actually used (except for the fact that

> the interface made it's methods public and the implementation had them

> private), since the only place that used the interface directly created

> the BrowserRenderer which implemented the interface thus it was removed.

>

> UiBrowserInterface had only a single remaining method which was a noop,

> so it was removed.

>

> A few minor changes were made:

> Floor Height was never set, and so it was removed and its usage

> simplified.

>

> TransparentQuadRenderer was effectively unused since it was impossible

> for DrawTexturedQuad to be passed an invalid texture.

>

> Some UiCreation exports/indirections were created for the VR DFM and are

> thus no longer needed.

>

> `PerformActionAndWaitForVisibilityStatus` didn't actually perform the

> passed in action and all callers were passing `Base::DoNothing` anyway,

> so the method was renamed to `WaitForVisibilityStatus` and the action

> param was removed.

>

> A few removals happened because they were either now or previously no

> longer referenced:

> Some strings

> chrome/browser/vr/vector_icons

> Backplanes Draw Phase

> Element Names/Friendly Names

> Various values and enums in `ui_test_input`

>

> Bug: 913607

> Change-Id: Ib779ac6a02bdf864c0f54280ac69ff49914ac70c

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5171274

> Reviewed-by: Brandon Jones

> Commit-Queue: Alexander Cooper

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1245439}



Bug: 913607

Change-Id: Ib1af38c132eddfc72624ae8f30c7d491185640ac

entry.title: Reland "Add field trial test config for IsolateSandboxIframes study."
entry.content:
This reverts commit a4b38b9f6e38eda73b7db68bb996d3ac2be0801d.



Reason for revert: Fixed the test flakiness that caused the first attempt to be reverted in https://crbug.com/1515720 and https://crbug.com/1515794.



Original change's description:

> Revert "Add field trial test config for IsolateSandboxIframes study."

>

> This reverts commit 1aeb9ea2da6b1903b41ce61cd179482a49182c5b.

>

> Reason for revert: Potential culprit for a consistent test failure.

> Please see https://crbug.com/1515720 for more details.

>

> Original change's description:

> > Add field trial test config for IsolateSandboxIframes study.

> >

> > This CL sets the necessary config to force tests to run with

> > the same settings as the trial, with per-origin mode being the

> > expected launch config.

> >

> > A number of WPTs fail in the new configuration dues to existing

> > bugs. These are:

> >

> > ** Issue 1407078: beforeunload handlers triggered by window.close()

> > don't work in OOPIFs

> >

> > fast/frames/sandboxed-iframe-close-top-noclose.html

> > fast/frames/sandboxed-iframe-close-top.html

> >

> > ** Issue 1066891: TestDriver click is flaky with cross-origin frames:

> >

> > external/wpt/bluetooth/requestDevice/sandboxed_iframe.https.window.html

> > external/wpt/bluetooth/requestLEScan/sandboxed_iframe.https.window.html

> > virtual/web-bluetooth-new-permissions-backend/external/wpt/bluetooth/requestDevice/sandboxed_iframe.https.window.html

> > virtual/web-bluetooth-new-permissions-backend/external/wpt/bluetooth/requestLEScan/sandboxed_iframe.https.window.html

> >

> > A number of WPTs have slightly different expected text output

> > with the new feature, since some warning console message are

> > treated differently for local vs. remote frames, and

> > IsolateSandboxIframes causes some frames that used to be local

> > to become remote.

> > (In these cases, the existing expected output has been updated to

> > match what a remote frame would show, with the original output

> > copied to a flag-specific directory since the tests also run in

> > the virtual test suite "disable-site-isolation-trials" without

> > the IsolateSandboxIframes behavior).

> >

> > third_party/blink/web_tests/fast/frames/sandboxed-iframe-close-top-noclose-expected.txt

entry.title: Remove and simplify UI after VRB removal
entry.content:
After the VR Browser removal, there are a number of interfaces that

had only a single implementation outside of testing, often with that

implementation being either solely a no-op or having some additional

complexity in order to support splitting the code into these interfaces.

One of the most complex things that was now only enabled in tests was

the `gvr_input_support` bool which enabled a lot of input infrastructure

which is now not processed at all, thus enabling a lot of cleanups. This

change thus removes the input infrastructure and the no-op interface

methods. The most interesting removal caused by the removal of this UI

infrastructure is that kWebVrExclusiveScreenToast could no longer be

made visible from production code, but it could (and it's visibility

was checked) from test code. While tests were modified because of this,

it does not appear that any valid scenarios are now tested less.



Two interface methods had some slightly complex behavior which was

instead simplified:

SchedulerDelegate's OnPose method was called by the

`VrBrowserRendererThreadWin` to call a method onto the `BrowserRenderer`

which then made a callback to the `SchedulerDelegate` who triggered a

callback that it received from the `VrBrowserRendererThreadWin`, all on

the same thread. This circler dependency was simplified to have

`VrBrowserRendererThreadWin` both call `BrowserRenderer` directly (since

it already owned it), and to call it's own follow-up method after an

appropriate call was made.



BrowserRendererBrowserInterface was now only used by tests to be

notified when the visibility state of a requested UI had been changed,

and it could only listen for the visibility state changes of one piece

of UI at a time. Thus the BrowserRendererBrowserInterface was removed

and replaced with a simple `OnceCallback` on the struct that was passed

in to set up the wait for a visibility state change. This struct was

also simplified as two different structs existed; one which was created

by the tests and one which was created by the product code, with only

very minimal differences that could easily be adapted.



Other noteworthy interface changes are:

SchedulerBrowserRendererInterface now only had one implementation and

the interface itself wasn't actually used (except for the fact that

the interface made it's methods public and the implementation had them

private), since the only place that used the interface directly created

the BrowserRenderer which implemented the interface thus it was removed.



UiBrowserInterface had only a single remaining method which was a noop,

so it was removed.



A few minor changes were made:

Floor Height was never set, and so it was removed and its usage

simplified.



TransparentQuadRenderer was effectively unused since it was impossible

for DrawTexturedQuad to be passed an invalid texture.



Some UiCreation exports/indirections were created for the VR DFM and are

thus no longer needed.



`PerformActionAndWaitForVisibilityStatus` didn't actually perform the

passed in action and all callers were passing `Base::DoNothing` anyway,

so the method was renamed to `WaitForVisibilityStatus` and the action

param was removed.



A few removals happened because they were either now or previously no

longer referenced:

Some strings

chrome/browser/vr/vector_icons

Backplanes Draw Phase

Element Names/Friendly Names

Various values and enums in `ui_test_input`



Bug: 913607

Change-Id: Ib779ac6a02bdf864c0f54280ac69ff49914ac70c

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5171274

Reviewed-by: Brandon Jones

Commit-Queue: Alexander Cooper

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1245439}

entry.title: Revert "Fix policy component's PRESUBMIT to handle policy removal"
entry.content:
This reverts commit ab38f0ad47c2f2b50a848c766970553c4ff44d62.



Reason for revert: breaks builder, ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/linux-presubmit/10856/overview



Original change's description:

> Fix policy component's PRESUBMIT to handle policy removal

>

> Policy component's PRESUBMIT check makes it impossible to remove support

> for a policy.

>

> From

> https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/main/docs/enterprise/add_new_policy.md#removing-support-for-a-policy

> - removing support for a policy involves updating the policy's YAML

> file and removing its test from policy/test/data/pref_mapping. But a

> PRESUBMIT checks for policy YAML file modifications that do not have an

> equivalent test.

>

> Modify the PRESUBMIT check to skip checking missing tests for

> unsupported policies.

>

> Additionally fix some formatting and grammatical errors.

>

> Bug: 1517264

> Change-Id: Ibdbdb322449471a1db86214843dab381f3f8b299

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5181357

> Commit-Queue: Kush Sinha

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1245301}

entry.title: [Privacy Sandbox] Add VLOG when attestation list is parsed.
entry.content:
Currently the Privacy Sandbox attestation list is generated via a

script, which is run periodically by an automated job. After the list

is generated, it is directly uploaded and picked up by Chrome component

updater.



We are adding a test before the upload. The test runs the Chrome binary

with the generated list to verify the parsing.



To do this we add a VLOG statement, then we can examine the Chrome log

to verify the parsing is successful.

entry.title: Add fuzziness to fluent web tests.
entry.content:
Adding a fuzzy meta tag to web tests that have Fluent Scrollbars

pixel expectations. Since Fluent scrollbars have anti aliasing in their

thumb and arrows, it can sometimes cause issues when trying to do a

pixel-perfect comparison of results.

The fuzziness tolerance added is pretty light, enabling difference in

color channels for up to ten shades, and up to ten different pixels.



For an example of issues caused by anti aliasing and expectations,

please see CL:5136754

entry.title: Shard Cronet instrumentation tests
entry.content:
The P50 of this suite is from 650 ~ 850 seconds which maps to (10 to 14 minutes), after taking a close look at one of the runs (https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/android-cronet-x86-dbg-10-tests/53554/overview), the shard runtime was 16 minute while the overhead was just 11 second. The tests are slow because they are executed in sequential order, sharding will result in a significant speed-up.



I've tried to create multiple (3) emulators and test this out locally and it seems to have caused a speed-up, unfortunately. There is no experimentation framework for the eng-prod so this will be a best-basis effort to determine if this change has caused improvement or not through a dashboard.



The number of shards chosen is an ad-hoc choice more than a scientific one, The average runtime is 12 minutes, so 3 shards should bring it down to (4-6~) minutes. Increasing the number of shards results in minimalistic change.



Change-Id: I22d569e7f7b4215910c211daf8ab659c8c1bc759

entry.title: Revert "Prerender: stop prerender from overcounting not triggered failure"
entry.content:
This reverts commit f16e811f86df29d768a63a918676058cef54125b.



Reason for revert: The Cl lead to multiple Browser crashes on latest Canary(crbug.com/1517106,crbug.com/1517137 )



Original change's description:

> Prerender: stop prerender from overcounting not triggered failure

>

> Before this CL, PrerenderHostRegistry records

> BatterySaver/PreloadingDisabled etc every time omnibox receives a new

> input, but this recording logic is not consistent to other final

> statuses. The inconsistent logic results in extremely high failure

> rate in UMA, but that does not really reflect the things we'd like to

> know.

> This CL rewrites this logic. WebContentsImpl::StartPrerendering will

> always creates a new PrerenderHandle instance. For PrerenderHandles

> whose frame_tree_node_id_ is invalid, it means that the prerender

> attempt was rejected by pre-checks. But we keeps this instance alive

> to track the historical attempts.

>

>

> See this document for rational.

> https://docs.google.com/document/d/1a1mlf_JxMD2018bRZtzCR0J0eqFPY_0myBOGdcV12ts/edit#heading=h.7omvz2uyeznq

entry.title: [base] Defer posting tasks inside WorkTracker::WaitNoSyncWork
entry.content:
This annotation defers posting tasks inside WorkTracker::WaitNoSyncWork.



It has been observed that inside WorkTracker::WaitNoSyncWork tracing can

happen, which can cause a PostTask, which can cause two `CheckedLock`s to

be acquired that are not annotated to be acquired in the same callstack.



This is roughly how the problem can happen:

* WorkTracker::WaitNoSyncWork acquires the CheckedLock

`active_sync_work_lock_`

* WorkTracer::WaitNoSyncWork calls `active_sync_work_cv_->Wait();`

* Tracing can happen (in multiple places). For example in the

constructor and destructor of

`base::ScopedBlockingCallWithBaseSyncPrimitives`

* Inside perfetto, based on how full the shared memory buffer chunks

are, it's possible that a PostTask happens.

* Inside PostTask, `TaskQueueImpl::GetTaskDelayAdjustment` can try to

acquire the CheckedLock `any_thread_lock_`



`TaskQueueImpl::any_thread_lock_` and

`WorkTracker::active_sync_work_lock_` are two checked locks that are not

annotated to be acquireable in the same callstack, so a DCHECK will be

hit.



Bug: 1515901

Change-Id: Id20e18dcf8f57113648503d9d80f097ffe5b4655

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5177389

Commit-Queue: Daniele Di Proietto

Reviewed-by: Etienne Pierre-Doray

Reviewed-by: Eric Seckler

entry.title: [Site search policy] Fix featured/non-featured disambiguation
entry.content:
The current implementation was triggering a CHECK when we tried to do

a "@work" search in the omnibox for a site search engine set by the

SiteSearchSettings policy.



The problem was that `SearchHostToURLsMap::GetTemplateURLForHost` [1]

tried to disambiguate between "work" and "@work" when "work" is the

keyword for a featured site search, and the status quo implementation

assumed that `TemplateURL::IsEnterpriseSideSearchEngineBetterThanEngine`

was only called for search engines with the same keyword - which is

not true if two search engines share the same host URL but not the same

keyword.



The proposed solution fixes the issue by calling

`IsEnterpriseSideSearchEngineBetterThanEngine` only if we are sure that

one engine was set by SSP policy and the other was not. When both engines

are set by the policy, it will prefer the one that is marked as featured.

Otherwise, fallback to the existing comparison using other signals.



[1] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/search_engines/search_host_to_urls_map.cc;l=56;drc=8ba1bad80dc22235693a0dd41fe55c0fd2dbdabd



Fixed: b/318549754

Bug: b/318549754



Change-Id: I71d5c11b4fcbc9c6054d5a2638d6be390b93a6b3

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5165468

entry.title: [AF] Set PopupType and FillingProduct in AutofillPopup pixel tests.
entry.content:
PopupViewViewsBrowsertestBase set the list of suggestions to the

AutofillPopupController, but don't set neither PopupType nor the

main FillingProduct. As a result, AutofillPopupController::GetPopupType

returns 0, which is PopupType::kAddresses.



This CL mocks both the PopupType and main FillingProduct. Main

FillingProduct is computed from the first suggestion in the list.

PopupType is passes as a parameter to the function. It will be removed

in the next CL, which removes usages of the PopupType in the

popup_row_factory_utils and popup_cell_utils.

entry.title: ui_controls: For drag-ending LMB release, post task after dispatch
entry.content:
By default, UIControlsOzone::SendEventToSink posts the closure before

dispatching the event. This is because during the dispatch, execution

may enter a nested message loop. That being said, most events don't

enter a nested message loop. This commit introduces the option to post

the closure after dispatching the event, which can be safely used if it

is known that the dispatch will not enter a nested message loop. This

provides finer-grained control over the ordering of outbound Wayland

messages. For example, this option allows us to send zcr_ui_controls::

request_processed after wl_data_source::dnd_finished when a drag session

is ended by a left-mouse-button release event. Without this option, Exo

always sends request_processed before dnd_finished, which results in

non-deterministic behavior in Lacros interactive_ui_tests.



Change-Id: Ibb2e11ffb04fdf2b1212cbf4a76bdaf7badc299c

entry.title: Add a ScriptWrappable::ToV8(ScriptState*)
entry.content:
This is a move of ToV8HelperScriptWrappable() from to_v8_traits.h.

This has two advantages:

* A caller that needs to convert a ScriptWrappable to a v8::Value and

knows that its ScriptWrappable is non-null now has access to a much

clearer and shorter conversion method.

* ScriptWrappable::Wrap() can now be protected instead of public



Two of the other common wrappable base classes (DictionaryBase and

UnionBase) have existing `ToV8Value()` methods. Rename them to

`ToV8()` for consistency.

whenever results were fetched. This CL updates this to request the

updates whenever `body` changes height. This is useful for animations

as the height of `body` can change after result is fetched.

entry.title: Fixed optional toolbar button not updating icon tint correctly
entry.content:
Some buttons on OptionalButtonView supports tinting while others don't, this is currently handled by ToolbarPhone which adds or removes the button's tint based on the currently shown button.



This works for most cases, except when running an animation swapping between tinted and untinted colors (or viceversa). It would result in the user profile picture appearing as a black circle while dissapearing, or other icons showing up with incorrect colors.



This CL moves this logic to OptionalToolbarButton so we can correctly set each button's tint during the animations.

entry.title: Simplify and document Cronet API version plumbing
entry.content:
This reverts "Split Cronet's implementation and interface API

versioning" (commit c35074a30121a3d8a2fbc4ec7db7b6f7815bb972), which was

based on a misunderstanding of how Google Play Services API version

compatibility checks work. The Google Play Services Client SDK code will

always accept a Cronet API impl level that is at least

ApiVersion.MIN_COMPATIBLE_API_LEVEL, which is already a separate

constant from the "current" API level. There is no need for any other

constants.

entry.title: Use std::erase[_if]
entry.content:
This patch is just a code simplification.



It's much easier to write:

std::erase[_if](container, ...);

entry.content:
This CL adds a c++ observer class to observer URL loading. The class

added will be used in a subsequent CL.



To bring parity with other observer classes that have both C++ and Obj-C

implementations, the existing UrlLoadingObserver protocol is renamed to

`UrlLoadingObserving` so the postfix `Observer` would be left for the

C++ implementation.



The method signatures have also been updated so `const GURL&` replaces

GURL. This follows the best practise of go/totw/109 and also makes

testing with OCMock easier.

entry.title: PinnedState: Control pinned state from Ash asynchronously
entry.content:
This CL lets Lacros update kWindowPinTypeKey value when the pinned state

is acknowledged by Ash instead of immediately update it on PinWindow

call.



In the current implementation, it triggers ProcessFullscreen once when

Lacros intends to enter pinned mode by setting kWindowPinTypeKey to

pinned while actual pin behavior is triggered through

PinnedModeExtension::Pin which works asynchronously. This causes Lacros

to enter immersive/fullscreen state randomly before pinned state.



With this change, kWindowStateTypeKey is updated on receiving pinned

state configure event.



Bug: 1511187, 1508249

entry.title: media/gpu/V4L2StatefulVD: Fix recycling resources from ImageProcessor
entry.content:
In some configurations (MT8173 eg Hana) VideoDecoder is used to feed an

ImageProcessor: the VideoDecoder's |CAPTURE_queue_| feeds the

ImageProcessor's OUTPUT queue. VD |CAPTURE_queue_| is managed using a

V4L2Queue. Buffers in a V4L2Queue can be in one of three states:

enqueued (hence ready to be decoded onto), in flight (i.e. in use by

some consumer), and free.



ToT transitions free-->enqueued in TryAndEnqueueCAPTUREQueueBuffers();

however in some cases, the queues are at capacity (|OUTPUT_queue_| full,

|CAPTURE_queue_| empty), preventing calling that method in the regular

ways. This erroneous behaviour became evident in a recently landed Seek

Tast test case: sometimes the Seek landed in e.g. second 19 of the 20s

sequence, causing Chrome to try to decode very fast (*), which fills

up both VD and the IP queues; since ToT has no way to recycle the

pictures explicitly upon resource releasing, it ended up in deadlock.



The solution is of course to try and reenqueue explicitly upon resource

being released. This needs a WeakPtr, which causes a rename.



(*) A

entry.title: Webgl2 conformance expectation clipping failure for all intel chromeos
entry.content:
Intel seems to have a slightly different implementation of the line

primitive than the webgl reference (or likely most other gpus). Line

primitives are not a well defined consistent feature of the API so we

will just silence these failures.



More details on the difference:



Rounding to nearest pixel occurs for the line primitive in the

vertical and horizontal. The rounding in the horizontal is the same

but the rounding in the vertical seems inverted. This results in a

disagreement by half a pixel. So if a line goes to 126.5+ the intel

implementation will fill pixel 127 whereas the webgl reference

requires the line to goto 127.0+ to fill this pixel.

entry.title: [ios] Fix issue with width of feed header when feed is turned off
entry.content:
When the feed is turned off, FeedWrapperVC creates an empty collection

view to contain the NTP which is similar to the collection view that the

feed creates. But this empty collection view isn't exactly the same and

constraints need to be adjusted to ensure the feed header's width is

correct, and that it is still possible to scroll vertically when

touching the horizontal margins of the NTP.



This change constrains the width of the feed header to match the new

moduleLayoutGuide. In order for this to work, the margins inside the

feed header had to be removed when FeedContainment is turned off so that

the edges line up with the feed itself. When FeedContainment is on,

those internal margins are necessary to inset it from edge of the

containment module.

should not be produced by the encoder but only the VideoStreamEncoder.

is the QualityScaler and all it cares about is the total encoder
